column4: Can somebody help me here?  Some people say that Linux is secure by default, and that by installing Linux you are basically immune to viruses because it is so secure.  Other people tell me that its not what OS you use, but the security practices you take.
it's both: linux is so small, not a lot of people target it, so the viruses out there are for windows. Plus, you can put yourself wide open to the few who do target linux
so am i right in saying that its not the OS that you use but the processes that you take to secure that OS?
all things being equal, probably true.
